abstracts.cdata!:
The project would assist Malawi in
            meeting its demand for wood products, managing and
            optimizing forest resources, increasing industrial
            productivity, encouraging privatization, and developing
            institutions in the sector. Specifically, it would provide:
            (a) technical assistance to WICO to enable it to operate
            profitably as a private company, restructure its Mazamba and
            Dedza sawmills and rehabilitate its Zomba mill. This
            technical assistance would further provide critical spares
            and equipment, establish training programs and carry out
            feasibility studies for new processing facilities, product
            development and quality control. A second (b) technical
            assistance component to the Government would be used for
            developing alternative uses for forest resources, mainly the
            large Viphya Forest.
